analyzed: isim pucchāma saṅkit ca  sādhu sammata
translated: “We ask the sage Saṅkicca,🔽who is esteemed by the sages,

in front of the assembly of sages.

analyzed: kam gatim pa id ca gacchanti
translated: What destination do people go to after death,
who have greatly transgressed the Dhamma?
I have greatly transgressed the Dhamma,
please tell me this when asked.”
The sage Saṅkicca replied,🔽to the one who increases the kingdom of Kāsi,
who is seated in the midst of the gift,
“Great king, listen to me.
For one going on a wrong path,
one who advises on the path;
If one were to follow their advice,
one would not find a thorn in the path.
For one who has gone down the wrong path,
one who advises on the Dhamma;
If one were to follow their advice,
one would not go to a bad destination.”
“The Dhamma is the path, great king,
but the unrighteous is a wrong path;
The unrighteous leads to hell,
the Dhamma leads to a good destination.
Those who live unrighteously, king,
people who live unjustly;

analyzed: yam gatim pa id ca gacchanti
translated: What destination do they go to after death,
listen to me about hell.
Sañjīva, Kāḷasutta,
Saṅghāta, and the two Roruvā;
Then there is another great hell,
the Burning and the Crushing.
These are the eight hells,
declared to be hard to cross;
Filled with those who have done evil deeds,
each one has sixteen lesser hells.
The terrible torment of stinginess,
the fearful Great Flame,
The hair-raising forms,
the dreadful, fearful, painful Blistering.
With four corners and four doors,
divided into sections, measured out;
Surrounded by an iron wall,
covered over with iron.
Their iron ground
is burning, full of flames;
All around for a hundred leagues
it stands filled with fire.
They fall into this hell,
with their feet up and their heads down;
Those who have transgressed against the seers,
the self-controlled ones who are austere.
They are cooked in the boiling cauldron,
like fish in a net;
For countless years
the evil-doers.
With their burning bodies,
always inside and out;
The hell beings do not reach
the door seeking to escape.🔽They run to the east,
then they run to the west,
They run north,
then they run south;
Whatever door they go to,
that very one is closed.
For many thousands of years,
people go to hell;
Raising their arms they cry out,
having fallen into immeasurable suffering.
Like an angry poisonous snake,
powerful and hard to overcome;
He did not sit with those of good appearance,
the restrained and ascetic ones.
Atikāya, Mahissāsa,
Ajuna, the king of the Kekakas;
With a thousand arms cut off,
he attacked the sage Gotama.
The unroyal one with dust on his body,
having scattered the emaciated one with a stick;
Like a palm tree cut down at the root,
that king fell into ruin.

analyzed: upahat ca manam majjhaḥ  mātaṅgasmin yasassine
